body:
> If I do managedChannel#shutdownNow, will ongoing StreamObserver(belong to this channel) do onError?

Yes.

> If yes, I think when service is unavailable at old address/port, I should kill the old connection.

It looks like the list of addresses is constant. Yes, you could remove one. But it seems like you have a problem that you won't learn of any new backends; eventually you won't have any backends.

In general, I'd suggest to create a `NameResolver` that parses `BACKEND_SERVICE` and returns the list of all backends. Then gRPC will try each in turn. But it seems like you need to resolve the fact that the backends change but the system won't learn about them.

2 requirements
1. Provide automatical test cases. Do you know where are they?
2. Send pr to master, after this merge. To avoid my cherry pick override your contributions.

yeah. i am writing  test cases  by now.
en, but i am forked  5.x repo,which should  merge 5.x  that it is no problem?
Yes. After merged, you can send a new one to master. Which should have same plugin core with 5. Don't worry about that. I proposal this, just because github only recognize contributions in master.
Thank you for your reminder. i try to do it.

Depend on what is your scenario. 
1. For a single request, trace and span are for `root cause analysis`.
1. For the whole cluster, topology is a quick view for `root cause analysis`.
1. For a endpoint(service in v5), service dependency maybe, In v6, we have p99/p95/p90/p75/p50 graph for root cause analysis.

So here we are.

Actually, We must know, this test is not standard, for example ,message size should designed as 100B, 1K, 10K, 100K, etc. But limited by time and resources, I can't afford it.

And Why I still to do this work? Because it is necessary, we all use rpc, and qps will be enlarged several times for skywalking-collector. I must assess the affect to biz if qps up to magnanimity.

Later if I have time, I think I will have a test that what biz happens when skywalking-collectors all crash.

> Actually, We must know, this test is not standard, for example ,message size should designed as 100B, 1K, 10K, 100K, etc. But limited by time and resources, I can't afford it.

You have done much more than others. Provide a very formal report.

Do you use any data mining algorithms for "root cause analysis"?

> Do you use any data mining algorithms for "root cause analysis"?

Right now, we don't have such thing in I known ecosystem. Maybe someone did inside their company.

From my perspective, `data mining` or AI is too heavy for APM, someone definitely is doing this. You should leverage between `what you can get from data mining/AI` and `the payment of people and infra/machines`

@IanCao Do you running with this code over one day ago?
No matter does this fix file handler issue. The codes look like an issue to me.

> Does skywalking-agent trace the motanStatsLog?

I don't remember we did that. You can read the motan plugin codes, it is very simple. We just use motan header to propagation across processes, that is all.

> I'm not sure it is actually fixed the too many open files bug.
> @IanCao Do you running with this code over one day ago?

no, It just started today. and i'll pay more attention to check whether this bug has solved or not

Its code is simple. I noticed skywalking using bytebuddy to do bytecode injection. Does bytebuddy used huge memroy? It seems doesn't use memory of xmx, xms.

If I change jdk1.8 to jdk1.7, the memory delta added will become much less.

> Does bytebuddy used huge memroy?

No, it will not. Byte Buddy is stable libs. Of course, code manipulation has risk. The cost should be perm size or meta space in different JDK.

One possible reason is are you using some dynamic class mechanism? Or motan using?

I have known, some debug tool could trigger this issue, such as Spring dev tool.

It Seems these had memory leak below:

Java_java_util_zip_xxx
Try to do the thread dump to find out who makes the leak.
I will keep this open with no milestone. Let's see what is going on.
Sharding-Sphere only integrated with skywalking on 1.x, for 2.x and 3.x, it does not implement yet. We will integrate 2.x soon, and integrate 3.x after 3.0.0 stable version release.
Tag as help wanted. Welcome the contribution from the community.

memory malloc is huge.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917749/45465176-9f1ef500-b746-11e8-8bcc-45b552356910.png)

It seems exists huge dead objects according to the dump result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917749/45465600-89aaca80-b748-11e8-8300-5d8f67f58d20.png)
1.7G file is dumped all objects that include dead objects. 54M file is dumped only live objects.

commands like this:
1.7G file:  jmap -dump:format=b,file=heap-dump-all-lbs-6G-DisableExplicitGC-JDK1.8.bin 
54M file:  jmap -dump:live,format=b,file=heap-dump-all-lbs-6G-DisableExplicitGC-JDK1.8.bin
Could you take a look, which objects cause the leak?

From I known, we didn't.

@raphw Do you know anything in byte-buddy could trigger this?
If I can have a heap dump, I can have a look. Potentially, some class loader does not clean up its resources when Byte Buddy requests class files.

Also add these
1. Add service call as the manual indicator. @peng-yongsheng You should add endpoint dependency manual indicator.
2. Refactor the core DIspatcherManager, to support generated and manual dispatcher at the same time.

Are these the reasons as below? It seems very similar as what I met. It costs only native memory, so I couldn't look it in the java heap.

https://dzone.com/articles/native-memory-leak-example

https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/instrument/ClassFileTransformer.html#transform-java.lang.ClassLoader-java.lang.String-java.lang.Class-java.security.ProtectionDomain-byte:A-

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3917749/45472272-4f502600-b766-11e8-9841-4e1e176fc5f1.png)
@hepyu Could you upload a dump file here? @raphw is the byte-buddy author, he knows much more things about class loaders and byte codes than me.
How I provide the dump file? email or something else?
@raphw Do you have any prefer place to go?

@raphw The dump file that contains all object is too large, much more than up limitation of git. Could you please provide email or some other way if you need to analysis.

I just remove sensitive codes from project, later will upload to git to help to locate problem.

> I just remove sensitive codes from project, later will upload to git to help to locate problem.

I think demo codes and a guide to reproduce the error should be helpful.

If you upload it to drop box or similar, you can send me the link to rafael.wth@gmail.com. I will treat the material confidentially.

It is not the issue mentioned by DZone. Byte Buddy handles this accordingly.
NPEs happen in alarm module. Some have been fixed in RC2, and one in this PR, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1661

@wu-sheng @raphw the example project is : 
https://github.com/hepyu/bird
